verses.verse: And there went <S%H3212><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of Levi, <S%H3878><s%> and took <S%H3947><s%> to wife a daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Levi. <S%H3878><s%>

And the woman <S%H802><s%> conceived, <S%H2029><s%> and bore <S%H3205><s%> a son: <S%H1121><s%> and when she saw <S%H7200><s%> him that he was a goodly <S%H2896><s%> child, <S%H3206><s%> she hid <S%H6845><s%> him three <S%H7969><s%> months. <S%H3391><s%>

And when she could <S%H3201><s%> not longer <S%H5750><s%> hide <S%H6845><s%> him, she took <S%H3947><s%> for him an ark <S%H8392><s%> of bulrushes, <S%H1573><s%> and daubed <S%H2560><s%> it with slime <S%H2564><s%> and with pitch, <S%H2203><s%> and put <S%H7760><s%> the child <S%H3206><s%> therein; and she laid <S%H7760><s%> it in the flags <S%H5488><s%> by the river's <S%H2975><s%> brink. <S%H8193><s%>
And his sister <S%H269><s%> stood <S%H3320><s%> afar <S%H7350><s%> off, to wit <S%H3045><s%> what would be done <S%H6213><s%> to him.

And the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> came <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to wash <S%H7364><s%> herself at <S%H5921><s%> the river; <S%H2975><s%> and her maidens <S%H5291><s%> walked <S%H1980><s%> along by the river's <S%H2975><s%> side; <S%H3027><s%> and when she saw <S%H7200><s%> the ark <S%H8392><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> the flags, <S%H5488><s%> she sent <S%H7971><s%> her maid <S%H519><s%> to fetch <S%H3947><s%> it.

And when she had opened <S%H6605><s%> it, she saw <S%H7200><s%> the child: <S%H3206><s%> and, behold, <S%H2009><s%> the babe <S%H5288><s%> wept. <S%H1058><s%> And she had compassion <S%H2550><s%> on <S%H5921><s%> him, and said, <S%H559><s%> This <S%H2088><s%> is one of the Hebrews' <S%H5680><s%>children. <S%H3206><s%>

Then said <S%H559><s%> his sister <S%H269><s%> to Pharaoh's <S%H6547><s%> daughter, <S%H1323><s%> Shall I go <S%H3212><s%> and call <S%H7121><s%> to you a nurse <S%H3243><s%> of the Hebrew <S%H5680><s%> women, that she may nurse <S%H3243><s%> the child <S%H3206><s%> for you?

And Pharaoh's <S%H6547><s%> daughter <S%H1323><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to her, Go. <S%H3212><s%> And the maid <S%H5959><s%> went <S%H3212><s%> and called <S%H7121><s%> the child's <S%H3206><s%> mother. <S%H517><s%>

And Pharaoh's <S%H6547><s%> daughter <S%H1323><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to her, Take <S%H3212><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> child <S%H3206><s%> away, and nurse <S%H3243><s%> it for me, and I will give <S%H5414><s%> you your wages. <S%H7939><s%> And the women <S%H802><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> the child, <S%H3206><s%> and nursed <S%H5134><s%> it.

And the child <S%H3206><s%> grew, <S%H1431><s%> and she brought <S%H935><s%> him to Pharaoh's <S%H6547><s%> daughter, <S%H1323><s%> and he became <S%H1961><s%> her son. <S%H1121><s%> And she called <S%H7121><s%> his name <S%H8034><s%> Moses: <S%H4872><s%> and she said, <S%H559><s%> Because <S%H3588><s%> I drew <S%H4871><s%> him out of the water. <S%H4325><s%>

And it came <S%H1961><s%> to pass in those <S%H1992><s%> days, <S%H3117><s%> when Moses <S%H4872><s%> was grown, <S%H1431><s%> that he went <S%H3318><s%> out to his brothers, <S%H251><s%> and looked <S%H7200><s%> on their burdens: <S%H5450><s%> and he spied <S%H7200><s%> an Egyptian <S%H4713><s%> smiting <S%H5221><s%> an Hebrew, <S%H5680><s%> one of his brothers. <S%H251><s%>

And he looked <S%H6437><s%> this <S%H3541><s%> way <S%H3541><s%> and that way, <S%H3541><s%> and when he saw <S%H7200><s%> that there was no <S%H369><s%> man, <S%H376><s%> he slew <S%H5221><s%> the Egyptian, <S%H4713><s%> and hid <S%H2934><s%> him in the sand. <S%H2344><s%>

And when he went <S%H3318><s%> out the second <S%H8145><s%> day, <S%H3117><s%> behold, <S%H2009><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> men <S%H582><s%> of the Hebrews <S%H5680><s%> strove <S%H5327><s%> together: and he said <S%H559><s%> to him that did the wrong, <S%H7563><s%> Why <S%H4100><s%> smite <S%H5221><s%> you your fellow? <S%H7453><s%>

And he said, <S%H559><s%> Who <S%H4310><s%> made <S%H7760><s%> you a prince <S%H8269><s%> and a judge <S%H8199><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> us? intend <S%H559><s%> you to kill <S%H2026><s%> me, as you killed <S%H2026><s%> the Egyptian? <S%H4713><s%> And Moses <S%H4872><s%> feared, <S%H3372><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> Surely <S%H403><s%> this thing <S%H1697><s%> is known. <S%H3045><s%>

Now when Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> thing, <S%H1697><s%> he sought <S%H1245><s%> to slay <S%H2026><s%> Moses. <S%H4872><s%> But Moses <S%H4872><s%> fled <S%H1272><s%> from the face <S%H6440><s%> of Pharaoh, <S%H6547><s%> and dwelled <S%H3427><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Midian: <S%H4080><s%> and he sat <S%H3427><s%> down by a well. <S%H875><s%>

Now the priest <S%H3548><s%> of Midian <S%H4080><s%> had seven <S%H7651><s%> daughters: <S%H1323><s%> and they came <S%H935><s%> and drew <S%H1802><s%> water, and filled <S%H4390><s%> the troughs <S%H7298><s%> to water <S%H8248><s%> their father's <S%H1><s%> flock. <S%H6629><s%>

And the shepherds <S%H7462><s%> came <S%H935><s%> and drove <S%H1644><s%> them away: but Moses <S%H4872><s%> stood <S%H6965><s%> up and helped <S%H3467><s%> them, and watered <S%H8248><s%> their flock. <S%H6629><s%>

And when they came <S%H935><s%> to Reuel <S%H7467><s%> their father, <S%H1><s%> he said, <S%H559><s%> How <S%H4069><s%> is it that you are come <S%H935><s%> so soon <S%H4116><s%> to day? <S%H3117><s%>

And they said, <S%H559><s%> An Egyptian <S%H4713><s%> delivered <S%H5337><s%> us out of the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the shepherds, <S%H7462><s%> and also <S%H1571><s%> drew <S%H1802><s%> water enough for us, and watered <S%H8248><s%> the flock. <S%H6629><s%>

And he said <S%H559><s%> to his daughters, <S%H1323><s%> And where <S%H346><s%> is he? why <S%H4100><s%> is it that you have left <S%H5800><s%> the man? <S%H376><s%> call <S%H7121><s%> him, that he may eat <S%H398><s%> bread. <S%H3899><s%>
And Moses <S%H4872><s%> was content <S%H2974><s%> to dwell <S%H3427><s%> with the man: <S%H376><s%> and he gave <S%H5414><s%> Moses <S%H4872><s%> Zipporah <S%H6855><s%> his daughter. <S%H1323><s%>

And she bore <S%H3205><s%> him a son, <S%H1121><s%> and he called <S%H7121><s%> his name <S%H8034><s%> Gershom: <S%H1648><s%> for he said, <S%H559><s%> I have been <S%H1961><s%> a stranger <S%H1616><s%> in a strange <S%H5237><s%> land. <S%H776><s%>

And it came <S%H1961><s%> to pass in process <S%H7227><s%> of time, <S%H3117><s%> that the king <S%H4428><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> died: <S%H4191><s%> and the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> sighed <S%H584><s%> by reason <S%H4480><s%> of the bondage, <S%H5656><s%> and they cried, <S%H2199><s%> and their cry <S%H7775><s%> came <S%H5927><s%> up to God <S%H430><s%> by reason <S%H4480><s%> of the bondage. <S%H5656><s%>

And God <S%H430><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> their groaning, <S%H5009><s%> and God <S%H430><s%> remembered <S%H2142><s%> his covenant <S%H1285><s%> with Abraham, <S%H85><s%> with Isaac, <S%H3327><s%> and with Jacob. <S%H3290><s%>
And God <S%H430><s%> looked <S%H7200><s%> on the children <S%H1121><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> and God <S%H430><s%> had respect <S%H3045><s%> to them.
